comment.author: 59356005@N02
comment._content: I believe this is the 1st Livingstonia which was set up at what is now Cape Maclear

comment.author: 59377114@N04
comment._content:
Yes probably. Livingstonia moved up north in circa 1894.
Charles Jansen died in Malawi in 1882 and the boat was being used by 1888 so the photo is from the later 1880's or early 1890's.

comment.author: 60406173@N04
comment._content: Published sources, including H.H. Johnston, British Central Africa, 1897, give Janson, not Jansen, for both the person and the UMCA ship.  The latter was launched in 1885, laid up in 1936 and broken up in 1941.  This is Cape Maclear, near the south end of the lake (NOT AT CHITIMBA in the north), first site of the Free Church of Scotland Livingstonia Mission, Domwe island to left (north) of "The Gap".  The main Livingstonia Mission, founded 1875, moved north to Bandawe in 1881 then to Khondowe near Mt Waller in 1894, the Cape Maclear site being maintained as an outstation.
